avalancheActivity.comment:
As a consequence of the sometimes strong wind the already large wind slabs will increase in size additionally. These are to be found in all aspects. The avalanche prone locations are to be found in particular in gullies and bowls, and behind abrupt changes in the terrain.
The fresh and somewhat older wind slabs are in some cases prone to triggering, caution is to be exercised on very steep slopes at transitions from a shallow to a deep snowpack.
Backcountry touring and other off-piste activities call for experience in the assessment of avalanche danger.
As a consequence of warming during the day and solar radiation small and medium-sized natural dry avalanches are possible.
avalancheActivity.highlights: Wind slabs represent the main danger.

snowpackStructure.comment:
30 to 50 cm of snow, and up to 60 cm in some localities, has fallen since Tuesday above approximately 2200 m, in particular along the border with France. Up to 2200 m rain has fallen. The strong wind has transported the new snow. These weather conditions on Friday gave rise to unfavourable bonding of the snowpack in some places in particular along the border with France below approximately 2500 m. Naturally triggered avalanches and artificially triggered avalanches have confirmed this situation.
The snowpack will be generally subject to considerable local variations. In all aspects snow depths vary greatly above approximately 2000 m, depending on the infuence of the wind.

tendency.highlights: The weather will be sunny. The avalanche danger will decrease gradually.

avalancheActivity.comment:
As a consequence of the moderate wind the wind slabs will increase in size additionally. The fresh and somewhat older wind slabs can be released, especially at their margins. These avalanche prone locations are to be found in gullies and bowls, and behind abrupt changes in the terrain and on extremely steep slopes. Backcountry touring and other off-piste activities call for experience in the assessment of avalanche danger.
As a consequence of warming during the day and solar radiation small and, in isolated cases, medium-sized dry avalanches are possible, in particular at the base of rock walls, and in extremely steep terrain.

snowpackStructure.comment:
20 to 40 cm of snow has fallen since Tuesday above approximately 2000 m. The northwesterly wind has transported the new snow.
The weather conditions on Thursday gave rise to moistening of the snowpack below approximately 2200 m.

In all aspects snow depths vary greatly above approximately 2000 m, depending on the infuence of the wind. At low and intermediate altitudes less snow than usual is lying.

tendency.highlights: The weather will be sunny. The avalanche danger will persist.

avalancheActivity.comment: The moderate wind will transport only a little snow. In particular at intermediate and high altitudes mostly shallow wind slabs will form. Caution is to be exercised on extremely steep slopes, especially at transitions from a shallow to a deep snowpack, when entering gullies and bowls for example, in particular in the regions neighbouring those that are subject to danger level 2 (moderate). In these regions the avalanche prone locations are more prevalent. Restraint should be exercised because avalanches can sweep people along and give rise to falls.
avalancheActivity.highlights: Individual avalanche prone locations are to be found in extremely steep terrain at intermediate and high altitudes.

regions.name: B - VALLI DI GRESSONEY, AYAS, CHAMPORCHER

snowpackStructure.comment:
5 to 15 cm of snow has fallen since Tuesday above approximately 1800 m.
The snowpack will be generally subject to considerable local variations. In all aspects snow depths vary greatly above approximately 2200 m, depending on the infuence of the wind. On steep sunny slopes below approximately 2600 m a little snow is lying. At low and intermediate altitudes from a snow sport perspective, in most cases insufficient snow is lying.
